intro: Diphyes serpens, commonly known as the serpentine fern, is a unique plant species characterized by its distinctive, spiraling fronds that resemble a serpent's body. Its leaves are leathery and have a serrated edge, contributing to its rugged appearance. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
